speakers.bio:
As an Experience Designer at Frontend.com John helps define clients' business strategies, products and services through design. He has worked for clients all over the world helping to deliver sustainable and enjoyable customer/user experiences in the fields of healthcare, sport performance, software and fintech. Multi-award winning, John's work on digital government-citizen communication has been published in the peer-reviewed 'Iterations Design Review' journal, and he has also been recognised as a Design for Europe featured designer for his work with the UN's migration body, IOM. 

John is a co-founder and organiser of Ireland's largest design related community, DublinUX, has spoken extensively on the topic of user experience, and is a lecturer of Human-Computer Interaction at the University of Limerick. He holds a BA in Business Studies and a Certificate in Service Design.

speakers.job_title: Enterprise Agile and DevOps Transformation Director

session.name: Importance of continuous research and monitoring
Predictive Design: How to be one step ahead of your customers

speakers.bio:
Started out as an artist, but fell into tech through my love of logic.
Accidentally formed a company producing flash animations and games.
Sold out and became a front-end tech lead for an ad agency. Got bored
and wanted to go freelance but was approached by adyen. After 5+ years,
really enjoying the ride. Still making and showing paintings.

session.name: Managing Change: Implementing the UXDX Model

speakers.bio: David has been working in the software dev industry for 30 years and has been building and leading development teams for over 15 of those years, working in companies such as Oracle, Full Tilt Poker and Zalando.  As the need for speed and innovation increases in today's creative economy, David thinks the biggest question facing us today, is how we create great work environments where people are motivated and committed to solving today's complex problems. And love doing so. To aid in this goal, David is currently doing an Masters in Work and Organisational Behaviour in DCU with specific interests and research in the areas of self-determination theory, team autonomy, employee motivation, commitment and engagement in a hi-tech organisation

profile_picture.description: David Zalando, Head of Engineering, Zalando

stream.name: Research on motivating and leading a modern workforce

session.name: Always in Beta: Using scenario driven design for better understanding of user behaviour
Microinteractions as a triggering agent in product development and sales process
No risk, no reward: The joys of testing in production.

speakers.bio:
Natalia is the Director of Mobile Engineering at Hudson's Bay Company, overseeing mobile application and service development for Saks Fifth Avenue, Gilt Groupe and The Bay. She has worked in backend- and mobile-oriented engineering and leadership roles for the past 9 years, for companies including Zend Technologies and IBM.

Twitter: https://twitter.com/nataliabartol

Fabio is a Principal Engineer at Hudson's Bay Company, leading the development of backend services for mobile applications. Fabio strives for simplicity in systems and processes; a trait he has absorbed during more than a decade of experience in software engineering: in academic research, higher education management systems, and - most recently - e-commerce.

Twitter: https://twitter.com/faberoh

session.description: Natalia and Fabio will share their story of how the HBC DevOps culture and mindset evolved. Follow their journey from moving to a distributed microservice architecture to enable simple, quick and frequent production roll-outs, through phased deployments to dark and live canary nodes, to a radical 'no staging environment' approach. Hear about the benefits and caveats they've experienced along the way.

session.name: Ensuring company alignment to speed up delivery
Managing Change: Implementing the UXDX Model

Strategic Tools for Personas & User Journeys

speakers.bio: Michal is an experienced UX Designer with a strong passion for user and business research. He believes that great experiences are born from synergy between the users, the business and the technology involved. Close cross-functional collaboration in the design process is the way I always work. Apart from building experience in a variety of projects, he is an active user-centered design author and evangelist, who loves to exchange knowledge with the amazing UX industry.

session.name: Is user experience research a science?
Automated Infrastructure: Out with the old and in with the new
Absent today: Team collaboration and cooperation
